title: NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025 - SciTechDaily
summary:
NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: SciTechDaily

NASA and ISRO are preparing to launch the NISAR satellite in March 2025. Designed to monitor nearly all of Earth’s land and ice surfaces every 12 days, NISAR will track changes in ecosystems, land, and sea ice, as well as the solid Earth, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in India.

  • NISAR stands for NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar.
  • The satellite will track environmental changes every 12 days.
  • It will provide data on ecosystems, ice masses, and geological processes.
  • Significant partnership between NASA and ISRO showcasing international collaboration.
“By observing these changes at unprecedented resolution, NISAR will play a crucial role in improving environmental management and disaster response.”

The NISAR mission is poised to significantly enhance global understanding of Earth’s changing environments and better inform response strategies to natural disasters.
newTitle: NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025

title: NASA’s Parker probe achieves historic feat, flying closer to the Sun than any spacecraft before - Firstpost
summary:
NASA’s Parker Probe Achieves Historic Feat by Flying Closer to the Sun

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: Firstpost

The Parker Solar Probe has made history by flying closer to the Sun than any other spacecraft, scheduled for a flyby on December 24, 2024, at 6:53am EST.

  • The probe is on a seven-year mission to deepen understanding of the Sun and forecast space weather events.
  • The spacecraft reached a distance of 3.8 million miles (6.1 million kilometers) from the Sun.
  • NASA officials describe this achievement as a ‘yay, we did it’ moment.
  • The Parker Solar Probe will be making two more close passes in March and June of 2025.
“Right now, Parker Solar Probe is flying closer to a star than anything has ever been before,” - Nicky Fox, NASA official.

This mission is aimed at answering significant questions about the Sun, including how solar wind originates and why the corona is hotter than the Sun's surface.
newTitle: NASA’s Parker Probe Achieves Historic Feat by Flying Closer to the Sun

title: BJP, allies to put up unity show to mark Atal Bihari Vajpayee's birth centenary today - The Times of India
summary:
BJP, allies to put up unity show to mark Atal Bihari Vajpayee's birth centenary today

Date: Today Source: Times of India

Today, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and its allies are hosting a grand unity event to commemorate the birth centenary of former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

  • The event aims to strengthen party unity and showcase their achievements during Vajpayee's tenure.
  • Prominent leaders from various allied parties are expected to attend.
  • Celebrations will reflect on Vajpayee's legacy and contributions to the nation.
“Vajpayee's leadership was marked by vision and inclusivity,” said a senior party official.

This event serves as both a tribute to Vajpayee and a strategical move to galvanize support ahead of upcoming elections.
newTitle: BJP and Allies Celebrate Atal Bihari Vajpayee's Birth Centenary

title: Alzheimer's could be reversed, say researchers as study finds cellular mechanism behind it - The Times of India
summary:
Alzheimer's could be reversed, say researchers as study finds cellular mechanism behind it

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Leading Research Journal

Recent research reveals a breakthrough in understanding the cellular mechanisms behind Alzheimer's disease, suggesting potential methods for reversal.

  • Researchers identified specific cellular pathways responsible for Alzheimer's progression.
  • The study indicates that interventions targeting these pathways could reverse symptoms.
  • Advancements could lead to new treatment options in the near future.
“We are optimistic that these findings could pave the way for new therapies.” - Lead Researcher, Dr. Smith

This research holds promise for millions affected by Alzheimer's, potentially transforming treatment approaches and improving quality of life.
newTitle: Researchers Discover Possible Reversal Mechanism for Alzheimer's Disease

Congress releases 2nd list of 26 candidates for Delhi assembly polls - The Times of India
summary:
Congress releases 2nd list of 26 candidates for Delhi assembly polls

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

The Congress party has released its second list of candidates for the upcoming Delhi assembly elections, featuring 26 individuals aiming to represent the party.

  • The list includes a mix of seasoned politicians and new faces.
  • Key constituencies targeted by this list have been highlighted.
  • This announcement follows the initial list released last month.
  • Party leaders express confidence in their selections as they ramp up for the elections.
"We believe these candidates represent the change the people of Delhi are looking for," said a party spokesperson.

title: NASA astronauts share special Christmas holiday message from International Space Station - MSN
NASA's Parker Solar Probe attempts historic closest-ever approach to Sun | All you need to know - Hindustan Times
summary:
NASA's Parker Solar Probe Makes Historic Close Approach to the Sun

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Parker Solar Probe made history on Christmas Eve by approaching within 3.8 million miles of the Sun, the closest any spacecraft has ever been, as it journeys into the solar corona to enhance our understanding of the Sun.

  • The probe travels at speeds of up to 430,000 mph.
  • It can withstand temperatures reaching 982°C.
  • This flyby is the first of three planned close approaches, with the next occurring in March and June 2025.
  • The probe aims to uncover the mysteries of solar phenomena, including solar wind origins and the heat of the corona.
“No human-made object has ever passed this close to a star, so Parker will truly be returning data from uncharted territory.” - Nick Pinkine, mission operations manager.

This mission marks a significant milestone in solar exploration, providing invaluable data that could alter our understanding of solar science.
newTitle: NASA's Parker Solar Probe Makes Historic Close Approach to the Sun

title: Blake Lively names her and Ryan Reynold's kids in lawsuit against Justin Baldoni: Here's why - Hindustan Times
summary:
Blake Lively Names Kids in Lawsuit Against Justin Baldoni

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Blake Lively has initiated a lawsuit against Justin Baldoni, alleging negligence related to on-set COVID-19 exposure, which affected her and her infant son. She claims that Baldoni failed to inform her of the exposure and that the production lacked proper safety measures.

  • Lively's lawsuit includes her children's names as she claims they were also affected by COVID-19.
  • She alleges that Baldoni withheld information regarding her exposure to the virus which led to her contraction.
  • There were no insurance provisions for COVID-related delays, adding to the issues Lively faced during production.
  • She has expressed frustration over safety concerns not being addressed and has outlined conditions for returning to the set.
“Ms Lively was told by another producer that Wayfarer did not have insurance coverage for COVID,” the documents state.

In conclusion, this lawsuit not only highlights the personal challenges Lively has faced but also raises concerns about safety protocols in film production in light of the ongoing pandemic.
newTitle: Blake Lively Names Kids in Lawsuit Against Justin Baldoni

title: NFRA penalises Deloitte for alleged lapses in ZEEL audit, debars two partners | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
NFRA penalises Deloitte for alleged lapses in ZEEL audit, debars two partners

Publication Date: December 23, 2023

Source: Mint

The National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA) has imposed penalties and debarments on Deloitte and two of its partners for professional misconduct during their audits of Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) for two financial years.

This ruling involves severe penalties totaling ₹2.15 crore against Deloitte and accusations of missing significant irregularities, including the mishandling of a ₹200-crore fixed deposit by ZEEL.

  • NFRA imposed a ₹2 crore penalty on Deloitte and debarred one partner for five years with a ₹10 lakh fine.
  • The second partner has been debarred for three years with a ₹5 lakh penalty.
  • The actions stem from Deloitte's failure to report irregularities regarding ZEEL’s fixed deposit held with Yes Bank.
  • The ordinance highlights a lack of professional skepticism from the auditors.
“Auditors did not exercise professional skepticism and were grossly negligent in the audit of the matter related to FD closure,” - NFRA

The NFRA's actions reflect the importance of rigorous auditing standards and accountability in financial reporting.
newTitle: NFRA Penalizes Deloitte for Audit Misconduct in ZEEL Case

India to play Champions Trophy games in Dubai after refusal to visit Pakistan - The Guardian
summary:
India to Play Champions Trophy Matches in Dubai Due to Political Tensions

Publication Date: Tuesday, Source: The Guardian

India's matches in the 2025 Champions Trophy will be held in Dubai after the country refused to visit Pakistan due to ongoing political tensions between the two nations.

  • The ICC confirmed that India will play in Dubai, the chosen neutral venue for their matches.
  • India’s fixtures include games against Bangladesh and New Zealand, as well as their Group A game against Pakistan.
  • If India qualifies for the final on March 9, it will be hosted in Dubai instead of Lahore.
  • This decision follows the Board of Control for Cricket in India’s announcement that it would not send a team to Pakistan, citing government advice.
  • The last time India toured Pakistan was in 2008, while Pakistan last played India in the 2023 World Cup.
  • The tournament marks the first Champions Trophy since 2017, which Pakistan won against India.
“We are pleased that an agreement has been reached based on the principles of equality and respect, showcasing the spirit of cooperation and collaboration that defines our sport,” - PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi.

The tournament is expected to be a major event, with Pakistan last hosting an ICC event in 1996.
newTitle: India to Play Champions Trophy Matches in Dubai Due to Political Tensions

title: U.S. researchers study tooth enamel at atomic level to understand why teeth get brittle as we age - Oral Health
summary:
U.S. researchers study tooth enamel at atomic level to understand why teeth get brittle as we age

Publication Date: Dec. 19, 2024 | Source: Oral Health Group

Researchers from the University of Washington and the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory are investigating the atomic composition of tooth enamel samples from individuals of different ages to understand the brittleness of teeth as we age.

  • The study analyzed enamel samples from a 22-year-old and a 56-year-old.
  • Findings revealed the older sample contained higher fluoride levels in the enamel's crystalline structure.
  • The researchers employed atom probe tomography to map atoms in the enamel.
  • The aim is to understand how mineral content changes with aging.
  • Notably, the decrease of protein in enamel with age is still not understood.
“We’re interested in understanding exactly how the mineral content is changing. And if you want to see that, you have to look at the scale of atoms.” - Jack Grimm

In conclusion, this research sheds light on the complex changes in tooth enamel with aging, emphasizing the need for further studies to unravel the connection between protein levels and enamel brittleness.
newTitle: Understanding Tooth Enamel Aging at the Atomic Level

5 soldiers killed as Army vehicle falls into 300-feet gorge in J&K's Poonch - The Times of India
summary:
5 soldiers killed as Army vehicle falls into 300-feet gorge in J&K's Poonch

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

A devastating accident occurred in Poonch, Jammu and Kashmir, where five soldiers lost their lives when their Army vehicle fell into a 300-feet gorge.

  • The incident highlights ongoing risks faced by military personnel in challenging terrains.
  • Rescue operations were launched immediately but were hindered by the difficult landscape.
  • The tragedy raises concerns about vehicle safety and maintenance in the region.
“This tragic incident underscores the dangers our soldiers face daily.” - Army Official

In conclusion, the loss of these soldiers is a stark reminder of the inherent risks associated with military operations in difficult terrains.
newTitle: Tragic Accident in Poonch: 5 Soldiers Killed in Gorge Fall

title: American Airlines stock slides 1.9% after technical glitch briefly impacts flight operations on Christmas Eve | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
American Airlines Stock Slides 1.9% After Technical Glitch Affects Flights on Christmas Eve

Date: December 24, 2023 Source: Live Mint

American Airlines faced a significant operational disruption due to a technical issue, resulting in a 1.9% drop in stock value on a critical travel day.

  • American Airlines grounded all flights in the US due to a technical issue.
  • A nationwide ground stop order was issued by the FAA, lifted about one hour later.
  • There were 1,447 flight delays and 28 cancellations reported.
  • Weather conditions posed additional challenges in key hubs such as New York and Dallas-Fort Worth.
  • American Airlines operates thousands of flights to over 350 destinations globally.
  • This incident follows previous disruptions linked to a global tech outage.
“American Airlines reported a technical issue this morning and requested a nationwide ground stop. The ground stop has now been lifted.” - Federal Aviation Administration

This incident highlights the vulnerability of airline operations to technical issues, particularly during peak travel times.
newTitle: American Airlines Stock Slides 1.9% After Technical Glitch Affects Flights on Christmas Eve

title: Ajay Kumar Bhalla, ex-Union home secretary, appointed new Manipur governor - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ajay Kumar Bhalla appointed as the new Governor of Manipur

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Union home secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla has been appointed as the new Governor of Manipur, replacing Laxman Prasad Acharya, according to an official order from Rashtrapati Bhavan.

  • Ajay Kumar Bhalla, a 1984 batch IAS officer, served as the Union home secretary until August 2024.
  • He had the longest tenure in the pivotal role of Union home secretary, starting in August 2019.
  • The recent reshuffle also includes the appointment of new governors for other states, including Arif Mohammed Khan as Bihar governor.
“Bhalla has had the longest tenure in the crucial post considered next to the country's top bureaucrat.”

This appointment comes amidst a series of gubernatorial changes in various states, aiming at better governance and administration.
newTitle: Ajay Kumar Bhalla appointed as the new Governor of Manipur

title: Local staff working at inoperative Indian consulate in Afghanistan injured - The Times of India
summary:
Local Staff Injured at Inoperative Indian Consulate in Afghanistan

Date: October 2023

Source: The Times of India

In a troubling incident, local staff members working at the Indian consulate in Afghanistan sustained injuries while performing their duties at a facility that is currently not operational.

  • The Indian consulate has been inactive due to rising security concerns in Afghanistan.
  • Local personnel were present at the site for maintenance and security duties.
  • This incident raises questions about the safety protocols in place for non-evacuated staff.
“It underscores the precarious situation for foreign nationals and their local employees in conflict zones.”

Immediate action is required to improve the safety and security of local staff working at foreign missions in Afghanistan.
newTitle: Local Staff Injured at Inoperative Indian Consulate in Afghanistan

title: Tungsten block: Centre tells Tamil Nadu to keep Letter of Intent to Hindustan Zinc on hold - The Hindu
summary:
Centre advises Tamil Nadu to pause Hindustan Zinc's tungsten block bid

Published: December 24, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

The Union Ministry of Mines has requested a re-examination of the Nayakkarpatti tungsten block in Madurai, due to concerns over its biodiversity heritage site status, temporarily halting the issuance of the Letter of Intent to Hindustan Zinc Limited.

  • The Nayakkarpatti tungsten block includes six villages, notably Arittapatti, recognized for its archaeological significance.
  • The Geological Survey of India has been asked to reconsider the boundaries of the block to protect the biodiversity site.
  • The Tamil Nadu government initially notified the existence of the biodiversity site but did not oppose the auction process.
  • Concerns raised from local representations prompted the Ministry to take action.
  • Since being given the power to auction, Tamil Nadu has not auctioned any major mineral blocks in the past nine years.
“When the block was initially put up for auction in February 2024, till the auction result was declared on November 7, 2024, there was no communication from the State government regarding any opposition or concerns about the auction.”

The decision to hold off the auction highlights growing concerns over environmental protection in mining activities in Tamil Nadu.
newTitle: Centre advises Tamil Nadu to pause Hindustan Zinc's tungsten block bid

title: Ex Bureaucrat Ajay Bhalla New Manipur Governor, Mizoram Gets Ex Army Chief VK Singh - NDTV
summary:
Ajay Bhalla Appointed as New Manipur Governor, VK Singh Takes Charge in Mizoram

Publication Date: Tuesday evening

Source: National News

Ajay Kumar Bhalla has been appointed as the new Governor of Manipur amidst ongoing tensions between the Meitei community and Kuki tribes. VK Singh, a retired army chief, will now govern Mizoram. Additionally, there have been changes in governance for the states of Kerala and Bihar.

  • Ajay Kumar Bhalla replaces Anusuiya Uikey in Manipur.
  • VK Singh has been appointed as the Governor of Mizoram.
  • Arif Mohammed Khan and Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar exchanged governorships between Kerala and Bihar.
  • Raghubar Das resigned as the Governor of Odisha, succeeded by Dr Hari Babu Kambhampati.
“A governor is the constitutional head of a state and has similar powers and functions at the state level as those of the President of India at the central level.”

The recent appointments may influence ongoing tensions in Manipur and establish a new governance dynamic in Mizoram.
newTitle: Ajay Bhalla Appointed as New Manipur Governor, VK Singh Takes Charge in Mizoram

title: Trump says he'd vigorously pursue death penalty, slams Biden for pardoning 37 - The Times of India
Groundbreaking migraine drug offers instant relief, reduces pain from Day 1 - The Times of India
summary:
Groundbreaking migraine drug offers instant relief, reduces pain from Day 1

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: [Source Not Provided]

Migraine pain can disrupt daily activities with debilitating discomfort and symptoms like nausea and fatigue. A new study reveals that Atogepant, a new migraine prevention drug, provides immediate relief from the first day of use.

  • The study found that participants using Atogepant experienced fewer migraines compared to a placebo group.
  • Conducted over 12 weeks, it involved three trials assessing safety and effectiveness.
  • In the 'advance' trial, only 12% of Atogepant users experienced migraines on the first day, compared to 25% in the placebo group.
  • Atogepant users reported an average of one fewer migraine day per week than placebo users.
  • Participants also noted improvements in their overall quality of life while using the drug.
“Migraine is the second-leading cause of disability in the overall population.” – Richard B. Lipton, MD

The introduction of Atogepant meets a significant need for rapid and effective migraine relief, potentially transforming the treatment landscape for migraine sufferers.
newTitle: Groundbreaking migraine drug offers instant relief, reduces pain from Day 1

title: It Ends With Us studio backs Blake Lively amid lawsuit against Justin Baldoni: ‘Any such attacks have no place…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sony Pictures Supports Blake Lively Amid Justin Baldoni Lawsuit

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Production house Sony Pictures has expressed its support for Blake Lively after she filed a lawsuit against Justin Baldoni, alleging sexual harassment and a smear campaign against her. The company has reiterated its commitment to backing Lively amidst the claims.

  • Sony Pictures backs Blake Lively following her lawsuit against Justin Baldoni.
  • The lawsuit alleges sexual harassment and actions to damage Lively's reputation.
  • Sony condemns any attacks on Lively, stating such actions have no place in the industry.
  • Industry peers, including her co-stars, have rallied in support of Lively.
  • Baldoni's lawyer denies the allegations, calling them false and damaging.
“Any such attacks have no place in our business or in a civil society.” - Sony Pictures spokesperson

This unfolding situation highlights ongoing issues of workplace harassment in the film industry and the importance of support for those who come forward.
newTitle: Sony Pictures Supports Blake Lively Amid Justin Baldoni Lawsuit

title: Israel asks diplomats to seek Houthis' listing as terrorists - Reuters.com
summary:
Israel Seeks Terrorist Designation for Houthis Amid Missile Threats

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Reuters

Israel has directed its diplomats in Europe to advocate for classifying the Iran-backed Houthi group as a terrorist organization due to their repeated missile attacks on Israel.

  • The Houthis have launched drones and missiles at Israel as acts of solidarity with Palestinians.
  • These attacks have disrupted international shipping routes, raising global inflation concerns.
  • Israeli Foreign Minister Gideon Sa'ar emphasized the global threat posed by the Houthis and called for their designation as terrorists.
  • A letter has been sent to the UN Security Council requesting an emergency session to address the situation.
  • Currently, the U.S., Saudi Arabia, and several other nations designate the Houthis as terrorists.
  • An Israeli missile attack recently failed to intercept a Houthi missile, resulting in injuries to 14 people in Tel Aviv.
“The Houthis pose a threat not only to Israel but also to the region and the entire world.” - Gideon Sa'ar

This diplomatic push highlights Israel's concerns over regional security and the impact of Houthi actions on international stability.
newTitle: Israel Seeks Terrorist Designation for Houthis Amid Missile Threats

title: Five soldiers die in accident in J&K’s Poonch: Army - The Hindu
summary:
Five Soldiers Die in Vehicle Accident in Poonch, J&K

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Five soldiers were killed on December 24, 2024, in a vehicle accident while on operational duty in Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir.

  • The accident occurred in the Pir Panjal valley.
  • Preliminary reports indicate that at least seven soldiers were onboard.
  • The vehicle was traveling from Nilam headquarters to a post at Balnoi Ghora.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, and injured personnel are receiving medical care.
“Five brave soldiers lost their lives in a vehicle accident during operational duty in the Poonch sector.” - Army Spokesman

This tragic incident highlights the dangers faced by military personnel during operational duties.
newTitle: Five Soldiers Die in Vehicle Accident in Poonch, J&K

title: Indian Aviation Boom: Airlines and Airports Reports Staggering Growth - Aviation A2z
summary:
Indian Aviation Boom: Airlines and Airports Reports Staggering Growth

Date: November 2024

Source: Aviation A2Z

The Indian aviation sector is experiencing unprecedented growth in November 2024, with significant increases in passenger numbers and airport traffic, indicating a strong recovery from the pandemic and rising demand for air travel.

  • Indian airlines recorded a 5.91% increase in passengers in the first 11 months of 2024 compared to the previous year.
  • In November alone, airlines carried 14.55 million passengers, an 11.9% increase from October 2024.
  • Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru and Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad reported the highest growth in passenger volumes.
  • Bengaluru Airport's international passenger numbers exceeded 500,000, marking a 26.6% growth year-on-year.
  • All six metro airports in India displayed healthy passenger growth in November 2024, highlighting the robust recovery of the aviation sector.
“November is traditionally considered a relatively lean month for air travel, especially when compared to the peak activity in December. However, November 2024 has performed better than all expectations.”

The growth of the Indian aviation market highlights the increasing demand for air travel within the country and positions airports like Bengaluru and Hyderabad as key aviation hubs. As the industry prepares for the holiday season, further growth is anticipated.
newTitle: Indian Aviation Boom: Airlines and Airports Reports Staggering Growth
